YES
limit them
MAYBE

NO
let them
essay.welcomeNarration: Welcome to Essay Builder. Today you will learn how to write a B2 opinion essay. There are five paragraphs: an introduction, three body paragraphs, and a conclusion.
essay.sc1Narration: The introduction is just two sentences. A hook, then a thesis. Watch one example ‚Äî then move on.
essay.sc1QuestionNarration: Here is today's essay question. Should the use of phones be limited for young people? Choose your side, then follow the example.
essay.bodyInterSub: Watch how claim + support work in practice.
essay.sc2IdleTop: Each body paragraph has two parts
essay.sc2Kicker: Each body paragraph has two parts
essay.sc2NarrationIntro: Every body paragraph opens with a claim.
essay.bodyPairsNarration: Now watch three complete body paragraphs. See how all these pieces fit together.

bodyPairs.keyExpr: the main advantage of limiting phones
bodyPairs.rest: is that students can focus better in class. This is because phones are full of apps that keep interrupting you. As a result, schools that ban phones have seen big improvements in students' results.
bodyPairs.note: Open with a listing marker. State your point. Then give one or two reasons or examples.

bodyPairs.keyExpr: one key problem with too much phone use
bodyPairs.rest: is the damage it does to sleep. Looking at a bright screen late at night makes it harder to fall asleep. Consequently, tired students find it much more difficult to learn.
bodyPairs.note: Use a DIFFERENT listing marker. Name your point clearly, then show why it matters.

bodyPairs.opinion: as far as I am concerned,
bodyPairs.keyExpr: one problem that is often forgotten
bodyPairs.rest: is the effect on social skills. When young people are always on their phones, they get less practice at talking face to face. Therefore, they may find real conversations more difficult as they get older.
bodyPairs.note: This MUST be your own idea ‚Äî not one from the question. Explain it simply and clearly.

conclNarrations: Finally, the conclusion.
Restate your opinion ‚Äî but never repeat the same words.
Echo your two main points briefly.
Then rephrase your position in one clear sentence.
And close with a final verdict. Short. Confident. Done.

conclData.text: In conclusion, I firmly believe that the question of phone use for young people requires careful thought.
On one hand, limiting phones leads to better focus, better sleep, and better wellbeing.
On the other hand, smartphones have real benefits and should not be seen as purely harmful.
In other words, it is not the phone itself that is the problem ‚Äî it is how and when it is used.
Overall, a balanced approach to limiting smartphone use would benefit most young people.

pairs.r: smartphones are used by millions of young people around the world every single day.
pairs.f: Nowadays, smartphones are used by millions of young people around the world every single day.
pairs.link: Although this technology brings many benefits, there is growing concern about its effect on young people.
pairs.linkHtml: Although this technology brings many benefits, there is growing concern about its effect on young people.
pairs.t: This essay will discuss whether it is a good idea to limit how much young people use their phones.

report.welcomeNarration: Welcome to Report Builder. Today you will learn how to write a B2 formal report. There are five sections: an introduction, two finding sections, your own observation, and a recommendation.
report.interSub: State what the report covers. Then say how you collected the information.

report.sc1QuestionNarration: Here is today's report task. You need to assess school facilities and suggest improvements.

bodyPairs.keyExpr: that the school provides a pleasant learning environment.
bodyPairs.rest: What makes the library so valuable is that it offers a wide selection of books and resources. By far the best aspect of the facilities is the sports hall, which is modern and well-equipped.
bodyPairs.note: State what works well. Use formal impersonal language throughout.

bodyPairs.keyExpr: one major concern expressed by students is the outdated computer equipment.
bodyPairs.rest: By far the worst aspect of the IT facilities is that machines frequently break down. This is mainly due to the fact that student numbers have increased significantly.
bodyPairs.note: State the problem clearly. Support it with evidence from your survey.

bodyPairs.keyExpr: the school canteen is frequently overcrowded at lunchtime.
bodyPairs.rest: Students reported that queues are too long and seating is insufficient. As a result, many students skip lunch, which affects their concentration in afternoon lessons.
bodyPairs.note: This must be your own observation ‚Äî not one already mentioned in the task.

conclNarrations: Finally, the recommendation and conclusion.
Summarise the overall finding.
Give your first clear recommendation.
Then give a second recommendation.
And close with a confident summary statement.

conclData.text: Taking everything into account, it seems clear that targeted improvements would significantly enhance the learning environment.
To sum up, the findings clearly show that students would benefit greatly from updated facilities.
One key recommendation would be to replace outdated computers with modern equipment.
In order to maximise study space, I would strongly recommend adding more library seating.
Overall, these changes would make a significant difference to the daily experience of all students.
